meanings.definition: To overpower physically through superior strength.
meanings.sent1: The big wrestler was able to outmuscle his opponent and win the match.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outmuscle the heavy box and carry it up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The little ant tried to outmuscle the big beetle in a strength contest.
meanings.sent4: The powerful waves seemed to outmuscle the sturdy lighthouse, crashing against it relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel would outmuscle all the other animals to get to the acorns first.

meanings.definition: To defeat in a physical competition by being stronger.
meanings.sent1: The team with the most practice was able to outmuscle their opponents in the game.
meanings.sent2: He knew he could outmuscle his friend in arm wrestling due to his strong arms.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten tried to outmuscle the big dog in a playful wrestling match.
meanings.sent4: The champion boxer would always outmuscle his opponents with his powerful punches.
meanings.sent5: The determined runner would outmuscle the others in the race, crossing the finish line first.
